newsitem.title: UK: Imperial Tobacco shares open at 390p.
newsitem.headline: Imperial Tobacco shares open at 390p.

text.p: Shares in Imperial Tobacco Plc began trading at 390p at the start of business on Tuesday as the stock made its debut following its spin-off from demerging conglomerate Hanson Plc.
The price was above expectations which fixed on a range of between 370p and 380p. By 0738 GMT the stock had made further headway to 393-1/2p.

At the official 0730 GMT start of trading the shares were briefly in backwardation, with ABN AMRO Hoare Govett offering to buy the stock at 390p while BZW was quoting a sell price of 385p on the London Stock Exchange's Seaq trading screens.
Tomorrow a second new stock spun off from Hanson, Millennium Chemical, begins trading in New York.
Adjusted for the two spin-offs, Hanson shares were down 3/4p at 94-1/2 in heavy trading of more than 1 million shares.
